summary: The video is a tutorial on how to create a desktop application. It shows examples of desktop apps like an egg timer and tic-tac-toe, and mentions a full step-by-step tutorial available on YouTube. The creator also provides access to a template code on GitHub. The video concludes with the creator waving goodbye.
on_screen_text: Easy cute little desktop app tutorial
How to code ur first little desktop app from scratch (beginner friendly & cozy aesthetic :3)
IMPORTANT: Click & open README.md for full instructions
A simple ElectronJS starter template for building desktop apps.
This repo is part of my YouTube tutorial on setting up your first simple, beginner-friendly, and easy-to-customize for any app.
This repo is a part of my Youtube tutorial on how to build your first desktop app.
Figma design file for this project: https://www.figma.com/...
A simple desktop calendar app built with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Electron.
This project is part of my YouTube tutorial series on building your first Electron app.
I posted a full YouTube tutorial walking through how to build the code along the way.
transcript: Easy cute little desktop app tutorial. desktop applications. like these? This is how to make your very first desktop application. super beginner friendly. youtube: nashallery. I have a full step-by-step tutorial on my YouTube from how to set up everything that you'll need to coding and styling your very first desktop app. Or if you just want to grab a template code. github: nasha-wanich. happy coding! bye :<3
